message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest normal pressure hydrocephalus (NPH), which can be treated with the placement of a shunt to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain. Galantamine and Selegiline are used to treat dementia, but they are not effective for NPH. Tetrabenazine is used to treat movement disorders, but is not indicated for NPH.

Galantamine is used for Alzheimer's disease, Selegiline is used for Parkinson's disease, and Tetrabenazine is used for Huntington's disease, which are not applicable in this case.

Galantamine, Selegiline, and Tetrabenazine are used to treat dementia and movement disorders, but they would not be effective in treating NPH.

The symptoms described point to possible early onset dementia or Alzheimer's disease, but the incontinence and tripping suggest normal pressure hydrocephalus (NPH). Placement of a shunt can be effective in treating NPH. None of the other options would be effective in treating NPH.
